title: Police Department Stop Data
description: A. SUMMARY The San Francisco Police Department (SFPD) Stop Data was designed to capture information to comply with the Racial and Identity Profiling Act (RIPA), or California Assembly Bill (AB)953. SFPD officers collect specific information on each stop, including elements of the stop, circumstances and the perceived identity characteristics of the individual(s) stopped. The information obtained by officers is reported to the California Department of Justice. This dataset includes data on stops starting on July 1st, 2018, which is when the data collection program went into effect. Read the detailed overview for this dataset here. B. HOW THE DATASET IS CREATED By the end of each shift, officers enter all stop data into the Stop Data Collection System, which is automatically submitted to the California Department of Justice (CA DOJ). Once a quarter the Department receives a stops data file from CA DOJ. The SFPD conducts several transformations of this data to ensure privacy, accuracy and compliance with State law and regulation. For increased usability, text descriptions have also been added for several data fields which include numeric codes (including traffic, suspicion, citation, and custodial arrest offense codes, and actions taken as a result of a stop). See the data dictionaries below for explanations of all coded data fields. Read more about the data collection, and transformation, including geocoding and PII cleaning processes, in the detailed overview of this dataset. C. UPDATE PROCESS Information is updated on a quarterly basis. D. HOW TO USE THIS DATASET This dataset includes information about police stops that occurred, including some details about the person(s) stopped, and what happened during the stop. Each row is a person stopped with a record identifier for the stop and a unique identifier for the person. A single stop may involve multiple people and may produce more than one associated unique identifier for the same record identifier. A certain percentage of stops have stop information that can’t be geocoded. This may be due to errors in data input at the officer level (typos in entry or providing an address that doesn't exist). More often, this is due to officers providing a level of detail that isn't codable to a geographic coordinate - most often at the Airport (ie: Terminal 3, door 22.) In these cases, the location of the stops is coded as unknown. E. DATA DICTIONARIES CJIS Offense Codes data look up table Look up table for other coded data fields

columns.name: doj_record_id
columns.description: Incident identification number, generated by the CalDOJ

columns.name: person_number
columns.description: Number assigned to each individual involved in an incident. Appended to doj_record_id to create unique_identifier

columns.name: unique_identifier
columns.description: Unique identification number made up of the doj_record_id and person_number

columns.name: stop_data_record_status
columns.description: Status of stop data record in SDCS system

columns.name: lea_record_id
columns.description: A record number generated by a local agency

columns.name: agency_ori
columns.description: The number for the reporting Agency

columns.name: nfia_flag
columns.description: Flag designating the data as having 'no further information available' (NFIA)

columns.name: stop_datetime
columns.description: Date of stop

columns.name: duration_of_stop
columns.description: Duration of stop in minutes

columns.name: is_stop_response_to_call

columns.name: location
columns.description: Location of stop

columns.name: district
columns.description: Police district for the stop location

columns.name: city
columns.description: City of the stop location

columns.name: is_location_k12_pub_school
columns.description: Stop on K-12 school grounds

columns.name: k_12_school_code
columns.description: School code

columns.name: perceived_race_ethnicity

columns.name: perceived_gender
columns.description: Perceived gender description of person stopped

columns.description: Perceived age of person stopped

columns.name: perceived_age_group

columns.description: Person stopped has limited or no english fluency

columns.name: perceived_or_known_disability
columns.description: Perceived or known disability of person stopped

columns.name: if_k12_school_is_student
columns.description: If stop occurred on school grounds, whether person stopped a K-12 student

whom_it_may_interest: Data Analysts, Policy Makers, Public Safety Officials, Sociologists, Researchers studying demographic impacts on police stops, and Citizens concerned with law enforcement and racial profiling

queries.Monthly: SELECT perceived_race_ethnicity, perceived_gender, reason_for_stop, results_of_stop, supervisor_district, analysis_neighborhoods, date_trunc_ym(stop_datetime) AS month, COUNT(*) AS stop_count WHERE stop_datetime >= start_date GROUP BY perceived_race_ethnicity, perceived_gender, reason_for_stop, results_of_stop, supervisor_district, analysis_neighborhoods, month ORDER BY month
queries.Yearly: SELECT perceived_race_ethnicity, perceived_gender, reason_for_stop, results_of_stop, supervisor_district, analysis_neighborhoods, date_trunc_y(stop_datetime) AS year, COUNT(*) AS stop_count WHERE stop_datetime >= start_date GROUP BY perceived_race_ethnicity, perceived_gender, reason_for_stop, results_of_stop, supervisor_district, analysis_neighborhoods, year ORDER BY year
